title: Introduction to Data Structures
subject: Data Structures
theory: A Data Structure is a specialized format for organizing, processing, retrieving and storing data. It enables efficient access and modification. They are broadly classified into Linear (Arrays, Linked Lists) and Non-Linear (Trees, Graphs).

examples.explanation: Example: A dictionary is a data structure (Hash Map) that maps words (Keys) to definitions (Values).

common_mistakes.correction: Arrays are great for read acccess but slow for insertion/deletion. Choose the right structure for the job.
common_mistakes.example: Inserting at index 0 of a 1M array is slow.

interview_questions.question: Why do we need data structures?
interview_questions.answer: To optimize efficiency (Time and Space) required to perform operations like search, insert, and delete.

summary: Data Structures are the building blocks of efficient software.
